result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony P. Olsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:44 pm - Defendant Anthony P. Olsen in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss but read in Count 1 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Drewa/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 1 yr
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Community Service 100 hours
Apology letter
Cooperate as requested with DA's Office/Law Enforcement
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs
Appeal rights given

Jury trial on November 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:58 pm - Defendant Anthony P. Olsen in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Oneida County Sherrif's Deputy Kelly Moermond.  
Sworn/Direct by Bednar - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Drewa.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  State files Information.  Drewa - In receipt of Information, waives reading and enters a not guilty plea on behalf of defendant.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

02:41 pm - Defendant Anthony P. Olsen in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
may not be on Family Pines Fun Center/ no contact w/co-defendants

03:18 pm - Defendant Anthony P. Olsen in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint,  Bednar/Drewa to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  
Bail continued  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
